question: Format answer for: Regarding patient 'AII-11' from family 'Family A': What is the genomic-level notation for the first mutation?
context:
The genomic-level notation for the first mutation in patient 'AII-11' from family 'Family A' is **c.1858G>A**.

This is stated on page 2, in the second paragraph from the bottom of the left column: "Mutation of c.1858G>A (p.D620N) was identified in 3 Austrian families..." The document then goes on to identify patient AII-11 as having the p.D620N mutation (e.g., Figure 1 caption, Table 1). Page 3, in the paragraph under "Results" and above Table 1, states: "Patients carrying the p.D620N mutation did not have any other variants in all exons of VPS35," indicating this is the relevant mutation. The connection between p.D620N and c.1858G>A is made multiple times (e.g., also page 2, right column, "Genetic Analysis" section).
